intro: Lepargyrea, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It comprises several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its rough, often hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit, resembling a fig, is typically edible and has a sweet, fig-like flavor. Lepargyrea is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
